alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 2:56PM AKST until January 12 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills ranging 40 to 55 below are occurring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Now to 6 AM Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Westerly winds gusting to 25 mph will gradually weaken overnight, but continue to lead to wind chills ranging 40 to 55 below. These gusty winds will also lead to areas of blowing and drifting snow. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
